sen.j: 成相寺（なりあいじ）は、京都府宮津市にある寺院。
sen.e: Nariai-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Nariai-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Nariai-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は成相山。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Nariaizan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Nariaizan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Nariaizan.

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第28番札所。
sen.e: It is the 28th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 28th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 28th of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
sen.cmt: 「西国三十三箇所」の訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 本尊は聖観世音菩薩。
sen.e: The temple's principal image is the Sacred Avalokitesvara.
The temple's principal image is the Sacred Avalokitesvara.
The temple's principal image is the Sacred Avalokitesvara.

sen.j: 真言宗単立。
sen.e: It is an independent temple of the Shingon Sect.
It is an independent temple of the Shingon Sect.
It is an independent temple of Shingon Sect.

sen.j: 日本三景のひとつ天橋立が一望できる。
sen.e: It offers an unbroken view of Amanohashidate - one of the three most scenic spots of Japan.
It offers an unbroken view of Amanohashidate - one of the three most scenic spots of Japan.
It offers an unbroken view of Amanohashidate - one of the three most scenic spots of Japan.

sen.j: 寺伝によれば704年（慶雲元年）、真応上人の開基で、文武天皇の勅願寺となったというが、中世以前の寺史は判然としない。
sen.e: According to temple legend, it was founded in the year 704 by Shino Shonin on the order of Emperor Monmu, but the temples pre-medieval history cannot be determined for sure.
According to temple legend, it was founded in the year 704 by Shino Shonin on the order of Emperor Monmu, but the temples pre-medieval history cannot be determined for sure.
According to temple legend, it was founded in 704 by Shino Shonin on the order of Emperor Monmu, but the temple's pre-medieval history cannot be determined for sure.
sen.cmt: 「 the year」を除き「temples」→「temple's」としました。

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）、高野山真言宗から独立し、単立系真言宗寺院となった。
sen.e: In 2007, the Nariai-ji Temple became independent from the Koyasan Shingon Sect to become a nonsectarian Shingon Sect temple.
In 2007, the Nariai-ji Temple became independent from the Koyasan Shingon Sect to become a nonsectarian Shingon Sect temple.
In 2007, Nariai-ji Temple went independent from the Koyasan Shingon Sect to become a nonsectarian Shingon Sect temple.

sen.j: 寺は天橋立を一望する成相山（569m）の山腹にあるが、創建時は山のさらに上方に位置し、修験の道場となっていた。
sen.e: The temple stands on the side of Mt. Nariai (569m), a location that provides a panoramic view of Amanohashidate, but at the time of its founding was located even higher up the mountain and was a place where shugendo was practiced.

The temple stands on the side of Mt. Nariai (569m), a location that provides a panoramic view of Amanohashidate, but at the time of its founding was located even higher up the mountain and was a place where shugendo was practiced.

The temple stands on the side of Mt. Nariai (569m), a location that provides a panoramic view of Amanohashidate, but at the time of its founding was located even higher up the mountain and was a training seminary for shugendo (Japanese mountaineering asceticism).
sen.cmt: 「修験の道場」の訳を統一のために修正しました。

sen.j: 現在地に移ったのは応永7年（1400年）の山崩れ以降である。
sen.e: It was relocated to its current location after the landslide of 1400.
It was relocated to its current location after the landslide of 1400.
It was relocated to its current location after the landslide of 1400.

sen.j: 山号は古くは「世野山」と称し、雪舟の『天橋立図』（京都国立博物館蔵、国宝）には、「世野山成相寺」の書き込みとともに当寺が描かれている。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix had long been 'Seyasan' and is depicted with the words 'Seyasan Nariai-ji' in the "Amanohashidate-zu" painting by Sesshu (Kyoto National Museum collection, National Treasure).

Its honorific mountain prefix had long been 'Seyasan' and is depicted with the words 'Seyasan Nariai-ji' in the "Amanohashidate-zu" painting by Sesshu (Kyoto National Museum collection, National Treasure).

Its honorific mountain prefix had long been 'Seyasan' (世野山) and the temple is depicted with the words 'Seyasan Nariai-ji' in the "Amanohashidate-zu" painting by Sesshu (Kyoto National Museum collection, National Treasure).
sen.cmt: 「世野山」は定訳不明なので、漢字を併記し、「the temple」を追記しました。

tit.cmt: 配置を指すものではないので、左記訳にしました。

sen.j: 本堂 - 安永3年（1774年）の再建。
sen.e: Main hall: Reconstructed in 1774.
Main hall: Reconstructed in 1774.
Main hall: Rebuilt in 1774.
sen.cmt: 「Reconstructed」→「Rebuilt」（他のトピックと表現をあわせました。）

sen.j: 本尊の聖観音（しょうかんのん）像は33年に一度開扉の秘仏で、近年では2005年に開扉された。
sen.e: The principal image is a statue of Sacred Avalokitesvara that is usually concealed from the public and only revealed once every 33 years with the last time being in 2005.
The principal image is a statue of Sacred Avalokitesvara that is usually concealed from the public and only revealed once every 33 years with the last time being in 2005.
The principal image is a statue of Sacred Avalokitesvara that is usually kept hidden from the public view and only revealed once every 33 years with the last time being in 2005.
sen.cmt: 「秘仏」の訳を他のトピックとあわせました。

sen.j: 五重塔 - 1998年に完成した新しい塔だが、鎌倉時代の建築様式を再現した木造塔である。
sen.e: Five-storey pagoda: Although completed in 2005, this wooden pagoda recreates the architectural style of the Kamakura period.
Five-storey pagoda: Although completed in 2005, this wooden pagoda recreates the architectural style of the Kamakura period.
Five-storey pagoda: Although completed in 1998, this wooden pagoda is recreated the architectural style of the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 絹本著色紅玻璃阿弥陀像 1幅 - 鎌倉時代

sen.j: アクセス
sen.e: Access
Access
Access

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道天橋立駅で下車。
sen.e: Alight at Amanohashidate Station on the Kita Kinki Railway
Alight at Amanohashidate Station on the Kita Kinki Railway
Alight at Amanohashidate Station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
sen.cmt: 「Kita Kinki Railway」→「Kitakinki Tango Railway」としました。

sen.j: 観光船に乗車し一の宮桟橋に出て、ケーブルカーまたはリフトで山の中腹にある傘松公園に向かい、そこから山門までは丹後海陸交通の運営する登山バスでいく。
sen.e: Take the sightseeing boat to Ichinomiya Sanbashi, then a cable-car or lift to Kasamatsu Park on the mountainside from where the temple gate can be reached by a mountain bus operated by Tango Kairiku Kotsu.

Take the sightseeing boat to Ichinomiya Sanbashi, then a cable-car or lift to Kasamatsu Park on the mountainside from where the temple gate can be reached by a mountain bus operated by Tango Kairiku Kotsu.

Take the sightseeing boat to Ichinomiya Sanbashi pier, then a cable-car or lift to Kasamatsu Park on the mountainside from where the temple gate can be reached by a mountain bus operated by Tango Kairiku Kotsu.

sen.j: 徒歩で登ることもできる。
sen.e: The temple can also be reached by ascending the mountain on foot.
The temple can also be reached by ascending the mountain on foot.
The temple can also be reached by ascending the mountain on foot.
